intro: Lobelia arunachalensis, commonly known as Arunachal lobelias, is a flowering plant species native to the eastern Himalayas, specifically in Arunachal Pradesh. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
